thread.title: 3 Family Members Accused Of Conspiring To Distribute 8 Pounds Of Meth
thread.title_full: 3 Family Members Accused Of Conspiring To Distribute 8 Pounds Of Meth

author: NewsBreak Original
title: 3 Family Members Accused Of Conspiring To Distribute 8 Pounds Of Meth
text:
By Rome Floyd Metro Task Force Adam Carey ,
1 hour ago Eight pounds of meth recovered by the Rome Floyd Metro Task Force following a drug bust in North Rome. Rome Floyd Metro Task Force Three members of a Rome family have been arrested and are charged with conspiring to sell approximately eight pounds of methamphetamine, reports state.According to Floyd County Jail reports:Agents with the Rome Floyd County Metro Task Force arrested Annie Sue Chambers, 78, at her home at 22 Reece Street Wednesday, and charged her with conspiring to "transport and hide over seven pounds of meth at 513 East 14th Street."Her son, Alvin "Pink Worm" Chambers, 57, is charged with felony aggravated assault after he ran over an deputy's foot at a Popeyes Chicken on Shorter Avenue while fleeing after they recognized him as having an arrest warrant. He is charged with felony aggravated assault.Alvin Chambers was recently indicted in March for trafficking meth stemming from a February 2022 incident when police recovered four and a half pounds of meth from 22 Reece Street in North Rome.Alvin Chamber's nephew, Christopher Hosea Chambers, 41, was arrested on April 12 on felony gun charges following a traffic stop. Police have subsequently charged added drug possession charges after the task force found undisclosed amounts of cocaine and meth at his home in the Callier Forest Apartments on Dodd Boulevard.All three members of the Chambers family are charged with felony conspiracy to transport and hide over seven pounds of meth alongside other conspirators Elena Preto and Jaydah Alexander.All three members of the Chambers family are held without bond as of Thursday afternoon. The status of Preto and Alexander is unknown.
